title: Generic program not compiling
body:
The following generic code is not compiling 
```fortran
module A
  public :: jagged_type
  
  requirement r(T)
    type :: T; end type
  end requirement
   
  template type_t(T)
    requires r(T)
    
    type :: jagged_type
      type(T), allocatable :: row(:)
    end type jagged_type    
  end template  
end module A

program test
 use :: A
 instantiate type_t(integer)
 
 type(jagged_type) :: jagged(2)
 jagged(1)%row = [1, 2]
 jagged(2)%row = [(i, i = 1, 5)]
 
 print *, jagged(2)%row
end program test
```
The compiler is showing the following error:
```shell
syntax error: Token 'end' is unexpected here
 --> input:7:3
  |
7 |   end requirement
  |   ^^^
``` 
 The next one is a variation of the above by @everythingfunctional to circumvent the above issue but it also ended up in an error
```fortran
module A
  private
  public :: example
  
  template type_t(T)
    type :: T; end type
    private
    public :: jagged_type
    
    type :: jagged_type
      type(T), allocatable :: row(:)
    end type jagged_type    
  end template
contains
  subroutine example
   instantiate type_t(integer), only: jagged_type
 
   type(jagged_type) :: jagged(2)
   jagged(1)%row = [1, 2]
   jagged(2)%row = [(i, i = 1, 5)]
 
   print *, jagged(2)%row
  end subroutine
end module A

program test
 use :: A, only: example
 call example
end program test
```   
The error is:
```shell
semantic error: Number of template arguments don't match
  --> input:15:4 - 16:2
   |
15 |       instantiate type_t(integer), only: jagged_type
   |       ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^...
...
   |
16 |     
   | ...^^ 
```
